alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Fulton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 3:17PM EDT until August 21 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHWESTERN FRANKLIN AND SOUTHEASTERN FULTON COUNTIES... At 317 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 5 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. There have been multiple reports of flooding over roadways, ponding, and debris on US route 522. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and trained spotter reports. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... McConnellsburg, Big Cove Tannery and Needmore. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
